p: Our client is seeking a senior engineer to work on our unified MLOps (machine learning operations) platform and associated projects. This role will be based in New York City.

p.10: This role will serve as a point of contact with various teams responsible for model delivery: annotation teams, infrastructure engineers, machine learning engineers and product.

li: Work with engineering leads to define and build new features and subsystems for our machine learning platform.
li.1: Build interfaces and tools for researchers, engineers and data teams.
li.2: Assist research and product teams in use of the platform.
li.3: Help bring research algorithms into production and scale them alongside their products.
li.4: Stay in regular communication with research and product teams to understand how the platform can best assist in other teams' objectives.
li.5: Manage annotation work from first and third-party annotation teams as required.
li.6: Share feature drafts with internal stakeholders for review and feedback.
li.7: Participate in code review and contribute to technical standards of the company.
li.8: Develop and maintain automated testing and contribute to integration testing and rollouts.
li.9: Collaborate with infrastructure teams to provision services and establish deployment workflows.

li: At least four years of software development experience.
li.1: Working knowledge of Python, and solid skills in at least one major backend language.
li.2: Experience with data pipelines, job schedulers or applied machine learning systems.
li.3: Generalist with experience in web apps, backend services, and databases.

li: At least six years of software development experience.
li.1: Prior history of deploying and maintaining machine learning models in production.
li.2: Experience with low-latency services and performance-sensitive code.
li.3: Experience with modern front-end SPA frameworks, such as Vue or React.
li.4: Experience with data visualization or analytics.
li.5: Experience with WebSockets or other event-driven systems.
li.6: Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and service-oriented architecture. Experience with tools like AWSCloudFormation or Terraform is a plus.
li.7: Some familiarity with stats or machine learning, though this role is primarily for infrastructure, not algorithms.
li.8: Previously worked in a startup-like environment.
